item.title: About
item.description: Hi GSPS! My name is Dylan Cromer. I’m a second-year graduate student in the astronomy department at Cornell University. I am currently working with Prof. Nick Battaglia on extracting cosmological information from the thermal SZ effect, and general forecasting for future observation efforts such as CMB S4. I received my undergraduate degree in physics and mathematics from the University of North Carolina at Asheville, where I worked with Professors Brian Dennison on the origin of fast radio bursts, and James Perkins on surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy from silver lithographic nanoparticles.
